description: A node in the graph database that represents a Record Entity, with a set of different defined common properties than standard (resource) entities.

displayName.description: Display name, e.g. a person's preferred name or an AWS account alias

summary.description: A summary / short description of this entity.

description.description: An extended description of this entity.

classification.description: The sensitivity of the data; should match company data classification scheme. For example: critical - confidential - internal - public.

category.description: The category of the official record

webLink.description: Hyperlink to the location of this record, e.g. URL to a Jira issue

open.description: Indicates if this record is currently open. For example, an open Vulnerability finding (Vulnerability extends Record).

public.description: If this is a public record. Defaults to false.

production.description: If this is a production record. For example, a production change management ticket would have this set to `true`, and have a `category` = `change` property. Another example would be a Vulnerability finding in production.

approved.description: If this is record has been reviewed and approved.

approvedOn.description: The timestamp (in milliseconds since epoch) when this record was approved.

approvers.description: The list of approvers on the record.

reporter.description: The person or system that reported or created this record.

reportedOn.description: The timestamp (in milliseconds since epoch) when this record was reported/opened. In most cases, this would be the same as `createdOn` but occasionally a record can be created at a different time than when it was first reported.

createdOn.description: The timestamp (in milliseconds since epoch) when the entity was created at the source. This is different than `_createdOn` which is the timestamp the entity was first ingested into JupiterOne.

updatedOn.description: The timestamp (in milliseconds since epoch) when the entity was last updated at the source.

exception.description: Indicates if this record has an applied exception. For example, exception for a known finding or a PR that is not fully approved.
